metadata.topic_title: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Security Flaws

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of implementing BYOD in a post-COVID hybrid workforce: How do cost savings and employee satisfaction weigh against security flaws like data commingling and insider threats? Use real-world examples from breaches (e.g., lost personal devices exposing corporate data) to support arguments and propose balanced solutions.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Topic: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Security Flaws. Hierarchy (verbatim): Level 1: Cybersecurity > Level 2: Security Architecture And Engineering > Level 3: Security Architecture Vulnerabilities > Level 4: System Architecture Vulnerabilities > Level 5: Client System Architecture Weaknesses > Level 6: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Security Flaws. Learning Objectives: [INSERT ARRAY FROM ABOVE]. Scaffolding: [INSERT FULL SCAFFOLDING FROM ABOVE]. Active Learning Tie-Ins: Reference discussion/peer/problem-solving in explanations where relevant. Big Picture: Fits Security Architecture as client-side vulnerabilities in hybrid workforces; critical post-COVID for enterprise resilience. Prior Knowledge: Malware, phishing, encryption, endpoint security. Key Content (complete/research-grounded): Flaws - Lack of Centralized Control (unpatched, no AV; risk: malware/phishing), Data Commingling (corporate/personal mix; risk: exposure, hard wipes), Insider Threats (accidental sharing/malicious exfiltration), Lost/Stolen Devices, Shadow IT. Mitigations: MDM, policies, zero-trust. Generate exactly 25 flashcards following the schema: For each - bloom_level (REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND/APPLY/ANALYZE/EVALUATE/CREATE), scaffolding_layer (Layer 1-4), question (MCQ/cloze/short-answer), correct_answer, distractors (EXACTLY 3, plausible protocol), explanation (pedagogical, with objective/layer tie-in). Output as JSON array of objects matching flashcard_schema format. Ensure progression: 20% REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND, 40% APPLY/ANALYZE, 40% EVALUATE/CREATE. Distractors plausible (e.g., confuse commingling with encryption failure). High-quality, error-free, educational.
